map function

Mar 18 2008 | WordPressBackup

map function: apply a function to each element of a list usage: map(function,list) example: >>> a=['1','2','3'] >>> b=map(int,a) >>> b [1, 2, 3] you can use map with functions of two lists: >>> def add(a,b):

return a+b

>>> a=[2,4,6] >>> b=[1,2,3] >>> c=map(add,a,b) >>> c [3, 6, 9]
